spell.name: Template Spell

components.m: opal worth at least 1,000gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: A mirror on the same plane of existence as you

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot cube

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Dexterity halves and negates deafness

A permanent, immovable zone of antimagic fills the area, suppressing all magical effects within it. At the DM's discretion, sufficiently powerful artifacts and deities may be able to ignore the zone's effects. The zone is dispelled only if more than 10 percent of its area overlaps with that of another antimagic zone spell (which is also dispelled).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot above 6th, the aberration's AC increases by 1, its hit points increase by 10, and when it deals damage with an attack it deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Antimagic Zone

components.m: opal worth at least 1,000gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot cube

A permanent, immovable zone of antimagic fills the area, suppressing all magical effects within it. At the DM's discretion, sufficiently powerful artifacts and deities may be able to ignore the zone's effects. The zone is dispelled only if more than 10 percent of its area overlaps with that of another antimagic zone spell (which is also dispelled).

entries.name: Area Suppression
entries: When a magical effect protrudes into the zone, that part of the effect's area is suppressed. For example, the ice created by a {@spell wall of ice|LevelUp} is suppressed within the zone, creating a gap in the wall if the overlap is large enough.

entries.name: Creatures and Objects
entries: While within the zone, any creatures or objects created or conjured by magic temporarily wink out of existence, reappearing immediately once the space they occupied is no longer within the zone.

entries.name: Dispel Magic
entries: The sphere is immne to {@spell dispel magic|LevelUp} and similar magical effects, including {@spell antimagic field|LevelUp} spells.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: While within the zone, magic items function as if they were mundane objects. Magic weapons and ammunition cease to be suppressed when they fully leave the zone.

entries.name: Magical Travel
entries: Whether the zone includes a destination or departure point, any planar travel or teleportation within it automatically fails. Until the spell ends or the zone moves, magical portals and extradimensional spaces (such as that created by a bag of holding) within the zone are closed.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Any spell cast within the zone or at a target within the zone is suppressed and the spell slot is consumed. Active spells and magical effects are also suppressed within the zone. If a spell or magical effect has a duration, time spent suppressed counts against it.

spell.name: Arcane Mirror

entries.name: Target
entries: A mirror on the same plane of existence as you

You choose a mirror you've seen on the same plane of existence as you. You create a scrying sensor inside that mirror. You can instead name an area, such as a specific building or city: you create a scrying sensor inside a random mirror within that area. If there is no mirror in the area, the spell fails.

You can see and hear from the mirror as if you were within it. If there is at least one creature within sight of the mirror when you cast the spell, you can take control of tht creature's reflection in the mirror. You can cause the reflection to act as you wish and to speak. Apart from the reflection's appearance in the mirror and the words it speaks, it has no effect on the real world.

spell.name: Awaken Portal

components.m: gold key worth at least 250 gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: Huge or smaller door or window

You impart sentience to a door, window, gate, lid, or other object that can be opened, closed, and locked. You grant it an Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma of 10. The door retains its hit points, AC, and other characteristics, and is considered an object. If the door is reduced to 0 hit points, it is killed and the spell ends.

The door is able to open, close, lock, and unlock by itself, and can speak and understand one language that you know. If {@spell arcane lock|LevelUp} is cast on the door, the door can activate and deactivate the spell at will. The door is friendly to you and follows your orders.

spell.name: Conjure Aberration
entries: You wrench open a hole in reality and summon a creature from the cracks between the planes. This creature uses the statistics of a {@creature conjured aberration|LevelUp}. In addition, roll {@dice 1d4} or choose the averration's general appearance.
Squid-like
Writhing ball of body parts
Humanoid with featureless face
Translucent worm

The creature is friendly to you and your companions and takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands. Without such commands, the creature only defends itself. The creature disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the aberration, which becomes hostile and attacks you and your companions. An uncontrolled creature disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot above 6th, the aberration's AC increases by 1, its hit points increase by 10, and when it deals damage with an attack it deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Escape

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to 5 willing creatures

If you cast this spell while underground or inside a building, you teleport to the outdoor space you occupied most recently within the last 24 hours. You are teleported whether or not the destination is hazardous.
The spell fails if there is 100 contiguous feet of earth or stone or a thin layer of lead in a direct line between you and the destination.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot above 5th, you can teleport two additional creatures along with you.

spell.name: Invisible Object

entries.name: Target
entries: One object

A Medium or smaller object becomes invisible, as do any inanimate contents inside it when the spell is cast. Objects removed from the spell's original target fter the spell is cast remain visible, and dirt, dust, and other markings may reveal the invisible object's location. The spell ends if the object deals damage.
Attacks made with an invisible melee weapon are made with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a 5th-level spell slot, the duration is 1 day. When cast with a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is permanent until dispelled.

spell.name: Magic Map

components.m: blank parchment and special inks worth at least 25 gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Area
entries: Special

You create a map with yourself at the centre, or update a map previously created with this spell. When creating a map, you choose its scale, from 100 by 100 feet to 100 by 100 miles. As part of the spell, you can make notes or other annotations on the map. The map only includes locations that you've seen and traveled through. The map doesn't show areas at a significantly different elevation from your current locaiton. If you cast the spell while you are lose, the spell fails.
At the DM's discretion, some magical areas can't be mapped with this spell.

spell.name: Metabolic Stasis

components.m: diamond-dust-filled hourglass worth at least 1,000 gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Area
entries: 50-foot cube
Creatures in the area when the spell is cast no longer age or require sustenance. The effect ends for a creature the first time it leaves the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast with an 8th-level spell slot, affected creatures no longer need to breathe.

spell.name: Ravaging Roots

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot square
Roots erupt out of an earth or stone surface that you can see within range, swelling as they smash stone and displace earth. When the spell ends, the roots wither away, but the damage remains.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the area makes a Dexterity saving throw or is {@condition restrained} by the roots, taking {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage. A creature already {@condition restrained} by the roots automatically fails this saving throw. A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself or another creature on a success.

entries.name: Ground
entries: Ground and floors in the area (and underneath ceilings in the area, if you cast the spell on a ceiling) become difficult terrain.

entries.name: Walls and Ceilings
entries: Constructed walls and ceilings in the area take {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of your turns while the spell lasts. A structure reduced to 0 hit points by this spell collapses. Most structures of worked stone have around 27 ({@dice 5d10}) hit points per 10-foot-square section, while natural walls and ceilings have half as many hit points.

When a wall or ceiling collapses, the spell ends early. Each creature in or directly beneath the spell's area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is buried by rubble. A creature buried by rubble that is underground is also unable to breathe. A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself or another creature on a success.

spell.name: Skeletal Hands

entries.name: Target
entries: 1 creature

Dozens of skeletal hands reach from a wall or other vertical surface to grasp a creature within 5 feet of the surface. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} until the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by the hands can use a bonus action to make a Strength saving throw to escape, ending the spell early on a success. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. When the spell ends, the hands withdraw into the wall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's initial damage and damage on a failed escape attempt increase by {@damage 1d8} per slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Stonesense

components.m: a rough figure of an earth elemental

entries.name: Target
entries: 1 creature
You imbue the target with a preternatural understanding of stone. The target gains tremorsense out to a distance of 60 feet.

Whenever the target makes a History check related to the origin of stonework, it is considered proficient in the History skill and gains expertise die on the check. If the target already had the Stonecunning trait, it makes the check with advantage.

Additionally, if the target is underground, it can make a {@dc 10} Intelligence check to correctly determine the distance between itself and the surface, or to perfectly recall any path it has traveled in the past week.

spell.name: Thunder Bolt

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot-radius sphere

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Dexterity halves and negates deafness

A peal of thunder ripples from a point you can see within range. Each creature in the area takes {@damage 9d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. If the area contains Large or larger nonmagical wood or stone objects, the objects take {@damage 9d6} thunder damage and creatures in the area that fail their saving throw take an additional {@damage 3d6} slashing damage from flying splinters. The thunderclap can be heard from 600 feet away.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For every slot level above 4th, the thunder and slashing damage increase by {@damage 1d6}, and the thunderclap can be heard from an additional 100 feet away.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two attacks.

action.name: Celestial Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunityattacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Bonus
entries: Entries

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrall that the thrall can see hits an aboleth with an attack, the thrall can make itself the target of the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary action
entries: Entries for legendary action

ac.special: 14 + 1 for each spell level above 6th (natural armor)

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) extra damage for each spell slot level above 6th. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (your spell save DC to escape).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the aberration. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) extra damage for each spell slot level above 6th.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth attacks once with its bite and twice with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the aboleth can't bite a different creature.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it contracts a disease called the Sea Change. On a success, it is immune to this disease for 24 hours. While affected by this disease, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws. After 1 hour, the target grows gills, it can breathe water, its skin becomes slimy, and it begins to suffocate if it goes 12 hours without being immersed in water for at least 1 hour. This disease can be removed with a disease-removing spell cast with at least a 4th-level spell slot, and it ends 24 hours after the aboleth dies.

bonus.name: Ink Jet (Recharge 5-6)
entries: While underwater, the aboleth exudes a cloud of inky slime in a 30-foot-radius sphere. The slime extends around corners, and the area is heavily obscured for 1 minute or until a strong current dissipates the cloud. The aboleth then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth attacks once with its bite and twice with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the aboleth can't bite a different creature.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it contracts a disease called the Sea Change. On a success, it is immune to this disease for 24 hours. While affected by this disease, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws. After 1 hour, the target grows gills, it can breathe water, its skin becomes slimy, and it begins to suffocate if it goes 12 hours without being immersed in water for at least 1 hour. This disease can be removed with a disease-removing spell cast with at least a 4th-level spell slot, and it ends 24 hours after the aboleth dies.

bonus.name: Ink Jet (Recharge 5-6)
entries: While underwater, the aboleth exudes a cloud of inky slime in a 30-foot-radius sphere. The slime extends around corners, and the area is heavily obscured for 1 minute or until a strong current dissipates the cloud. The aboleth then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Abolethic Agent
entries: The aboleth champion is treated as an aboleth for the purposes of an {@creature aboleth thrall|LevelUp|aboleth thrall's} Self-Sacrifice reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Serrated Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or construct, it makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it receives a wound. While wounded, it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) ongoing slashing damage and is {@condition rattled|LevelUp}. Further wounds on a wounded creature have no effect. A creature can use an action to make a {@dc 12} Medicine check, ending the ongoing damage and {@condition rattled|LevelUp} condition on a success. The effect also ends if the target receives at least 1 hit point of magical healing.

action.name: Strangling Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target is {@condition restrained} and can't breathe, and the champion can't use its strangling grasp on a different creature.

action.name: Mental Blast
entries: The champion emits a 15-foot cone of psychic energy. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition rattled|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn't {@condition rattled|LevelUp}.

bonus.name: Vicious Taunt
entries: The champion magically mocks or threatens a {@condition rattled|LevelUp} creature that can hear and understand it. The target makes a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Aberrant Physiology
entries: The swarm doesn't require air or sleep.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. It can't gain hit points or temporary hit points.

trait.name: Whispers of the Weird
entries: The swarm murmurs and whispers constantly, speaking secrets in languages beyond mortal comprehension. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the maw swarm and can hear it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage if the swarm is bloodied.

monster.name: Oculite
languages: understands deep speech but can't speak

trait.name: Aberrant Physiology
entries: The oculite doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Refraction
entries: When the oculite takes radiant damage, one creature of the oculite's choice within 30 feet takes the same amount of damage.

action.name: Energy Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

monster.name: Slitherwhite
languages: understands deep speech but can't speak

trait.name: Aberrant Physiology
entries: The slitherwhite doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The slitherwhite can grapple only one creature at a time.

trait.name: Detect Magic
entries: The bright orb senses creatures that bear magic and magic objects within 500 feet.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The bright orb sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Arcane Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage, and the target is subject to Consume Magic.

action.name: Consume Magic
entries: The bright orb targets a creature, an object, or an ongoing magical effect within 30 feet of it and attempts to consume the magic, ending one effect if the magic is temporary (such as a spell with a limited duration) or suppressing one effect for 1 minute if the magic is permanent (such as a magic item). If the magic was created by a spell of 3rd level or higher, the bright orb must make a Wisdom check against a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level or Consume Magic fails. At the DM's discretion, a success might cause a magical effect to malfunction instead of end.

action.name: Magic Missile Barrage
entries: The bright orb targets up to two creature within 120 feet, launching a barrage of magical darts of force at each creature. The missiles strike unerrringly and simultaneously, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) force damage to each creature.

bonus.name: Illusory Duplicate
entries: An illusory duplicate of the bright orb appears in its space. The duplicate obscures the orb's true location and moves with the bright orb for 1 minute or until it is destroyed. Whenever the real bright orb is targeted by an attack, there is a change the duplicate is hit instead. Roll the attack as usual; if the result of the {@dice d20} is odd, the attack hits the duplicate, and the duplicate is destroyed.

reaction.name: Blinding Rebuke (1/Day)
entries: When the bright orb is targeted by a harmful spell or hit by an attack made by a creature within 30 feet of it, it releases an intense flash of blinding light. Each creature within 30 feet of the bright orb makes a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

reaction.name: Consume Spell (1/Day)
entries: When a creature within 60 feet casts a spell, the bright orb uses Consume Magic, targeting the triggering spell.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The horror can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Horrifying Cacophony
entries: A non-aberration that starts its turn within 20 feet of the horror and can hear it makes a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition confused|LevelUp} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition confused|LevelUp}. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to the horror's Horrifying Cacophony for 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the horror fails a saving throw while it is within 60 feet of another aberration, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, an aberration of its choice within 60 feet of it dies.

trait.name: Warper of Reality
entries: Non-aberrations treat the ground within 20 feet of the horror as difficult terrain. The flying speed of any non-aberration creature within 20 feet of the horror is halved.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horror attacks twice with its claws, once with its horrific maws, and once with its stinger.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horrific Maws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., up to five targets. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution save. On a failed save, the target is implanted with a larval seed. The target is {@condition confused|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn and then takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage and two levels of {@condition strife|LevelUp} as a newly formed {@creature gibbering mouther|LevelUp} rips from its body.

action.name: Horrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The draconic horror exhales a blast of psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each non-aberration creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 63 ({@damage 18d6}) psychic damage and gains a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}. On a success, the target takes half damage and doesn't gain {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

legendary.name: Absorb Ally
entries: The horror consumes a Large or smaller aberration within 5 feet of it, regaining 27 ({@dice 6d8}) hit points.

legendary.name: Psionic Assault
entries: The horror targets a creature within 120 feet with a blast of psionic energy. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Charisma save or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also {@condition staggered|LevelUp} while {@condition frightened} in this way.

legendary.name: Whirlwind
entries: The horror flaps its wings, creating a howling wind. Non-aberration creatures within 30 feet of the horror must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet directly away from the horror or pulled 10 feet closer (horror's choice; same effect on all applicable creatures).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The morel attacks with its tendrils and uses Eat Dreams if possible.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is stabilised.

action.name: Eat Dreams
entries: One {@condition dazed|LevelUp} creature within 10 feet of the morel takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage. If this reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is stabilised but can't awaken until restored to full hit points.

reaction.name: Dream Spores (Recharge 6)
entries: If the dreamer's morel is in an area of bright light, it expels a cloud of spores in a 10-foot radius. Breathing creatures in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 2d4} hours. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way is also {@condition dazed|LevelUp} and experiences vivid hallucinations. Unless the creature is cured of the poison before the condition ends, it must make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw when it does end. On a failure, it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage.

monster.name: Fungal Zombie
languages: the languages its host knew in life

trait.name: Fungal Zombie Spores
entries: When the zombie hits a target with a melee attack and reduces it to 0 hit points, the target is infected with fungal zombie spores. If the target dies within 1 minute, it rises 1 hour later, gaining the fungal zombie template (Dungeon Delver's Guide, pg234). It loses its original personality and acts as an ally to other fungal zombies.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, the shrieker is indistinguishable from a normal fungus.

trait.name: Spell Sense
entries: The shrieker can sense the presence of creatures or magic items with the ability to cast spells within 30 feet.

action.name: Shriek
entries: If the shrieker perceives a spellcasting creature or magic item within 30 feet, it shrieks loudly and continuously. The shriek is audible within 300 feet. The shrieker continues to shriek for 1 minute after the creature or item has moved away.
While within 30 feet of the shrieking shrieker, a creature can't cast spells with vocalised components and can't concentrate on spells.

monster.name: Cerberus Guardian
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The guardian is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the guardian fails a saving throw while it has at least two heads active, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of its heads becomes inactive until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: While the guardian has more than one head active, it has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition debilitated}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}, and it can't be flanked.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian makes three bite attacks, minus one for each of its inactive heads. Each bite must be against a different target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poison Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Bronze Clangor (1/Round)
entries: The guardian's tongue tolls in its bronze mouth like a bell. Each creature within 60 feet that can heart the clangor makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. The guardian can't use this legendary action if its bronze head is disabled.

legendary.name: Iron Breath (1/Round)
entries: The guardian breathes poison gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creatre in the area makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. The guardian can't use this legendary action if its iron head is disabled.

legendary.name: Stone Howl (1/Round)
entries: The guardian lets loose a spine-chilling howl. Each creature within 60 feet that can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect on itself ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified}. The guardian can't use this legendary action if its stone head is disabled.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The guardian attacks with its poison tail.
